test_cases.name: baseline_photosynthesis
test_cases.text: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy. It occurs in the chloroplasts of plant cells. The process requires carbon dioxide, water, and sunlight. The main product is glucose, and oxygen is released as a byproduct. Photosynthesis has two main stages: the light-dependent reactions and the Calvin cycle.

test_cases.name: short_prompt_history
test_cases.text: World War II was a global conflict that lasted from 1939 to 1945. It involved most of the world's nations forming two opposing military alliances: the Allies and the Axis. Key events include the invasion of Poland, Pearl Harbor attack, D-Day invasion, and the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

test_cases.name: detailed_prompt_science
test_cases.text: DNA, or deoxyribonucleic acid, is the hereditary material in humans and almost all other organisms. DNA is made up of molecules called nucleotides. Each nucleotide contains a phosphate group, a sugar group and a nitrogen base. The four types of nitrogen bases are adenine (A), thymine (T), guanine (G) and cytosine (C). DNA replication is the process by which DNA makes a copy of itself during cell division.

test_cases.name: simple_definition_focus
test_cases.text: Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines. Machine Learning is a subset of AI that enables systems to learn from data. Deep Learning uses neural networks with multiple layers. Natural Language Processing (NLP) allows computers to understand human language.

test_cases.name: numbered_facts_math
test_cases.text: The Pythagorean theorem states that in a right triangle, a² + b² = c², where c is the hypotenuse. A prime number is a natural number greater than 1 that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself. The first five prime numbers are 2, 3, 5, 7, and 11. Pi (π) is approximately 3.14159 and represents the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter.

test_cases.name: application_based_programming
test_cases.text: Python lists are mutable, ordered collections that can contain mixed data types. Lists are created using square brackets. Common list methods include append(), remove(), pop(), and sort(). List comprehensions provide a concise way to create lists. Example: [x**2 for x in range(10)] creates a list of squares.

test_cases.name: comparison_style_economics
test_cases.text: Capitalism is an economic system based on private ownership and free markets. Socialism involves collective or government ownership of production means. In capitalism, prices are determined by supply and demand. In socialism, the government often controls prices. Capitalism encourages competition, while socialism emphasizes equality.

test_cases.name: minimal_prompt_geography
test_cases.text: The Amazon Rainforest is located in South America, primarily in Brazil. It is the world's largest tropical rainforest, covering approximately 5.5 million square kilometers. The Amazon River, which flows through the rainforest, is the second longest river in the world. The rainforest is home to millions of species of plants and animals.

test_cases.name: strict_json_chemistry
test_cases.text: Water (H2O) is composed of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has a boiling point of 100°C at sea level. Water is a polar molecule, meaning it has a slight positive charge on one end and a slight negative charge on the other. This polarity allows water to dissolve many substances, earning it the title 'universal solvent'.

test_cases.name: verbose_prompt_literature
test_cases.text: Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet is a tragedy about two young star-crossed lovers whose deaths ultimately reconcile their feuding families. The play was written in 1597 and is set in Verona, Italy. Major themes include love, fate, and the consequences of family rivalry. Famous quotes include 'What's in a name?' and 'A rose by any other name would smell as sweet.'

test_cases.name: question_types_biology
test_cases.text: Mitosis is the process of cell division that results in two identical daughter cells. It consists of four main phases: prophase, metaphase, anaphase, and telophase. During prophase, chromosomes condense and become visible. In metaphase, chromosomes align at the cell's center. During anaphase, sister chromatids separate. In telophase, two nuclei form.

test_cases.name: bullet_heavy_history
test_cases.text: The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the late 18th century. Key inventions included the steam engine by James Watt (1769), the spinning jenny by James Hargreaves (1764), and the power loom by Edmund Cartwright (1785). The revolution led to urbanization, factory systems, and significant social changes. Working conditions were often harsh, leading to labor movements.
